com.kilvish.core

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • com.kilvish.core.Sprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Actor

    public class Sprite
extends javax.swing.JLabel
    Simple class to represent an image or a simple animation consisting of a group of images.
    Author:
    Divyansh Prakash
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String name)

    • Method Detail

      • addImage

        public void addImage(javax.swing.ImageIcon img)
        Adds a lone image to the sprite. Use *only* if the sprite has no other images.

      • addImage

        public void addImage(javax.swing.ImageIcon img,
            int frames)
        Adds an image to the sprite that is displayed for the specified number of consecutive frames. Routes through addSpriteImage()

      • addSpriteImage

        public void addSpriteImage(SpriteImage simg)
        Adds a new SpriteImage to the sprite. addImage() is more suitable for most purposes.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of this Sprite.
        Overrides:
        getName in class java.awt.Component

      • setCurrentImageIndex

        public void setCurrentImageIndex(int i)
        Sets the image at the specified index to be displayed currently.

      • getCurrentImageIndex

        public int getCurrentImageIndex()
        Gets the index of the image being displayed currently.

      • getCurrentImage

        public javax.swing.ImageIcon getCurrentImage()
        Gets the image being displayed currently.

      • getSpriteImages

        public java.util.ArrayList<SpriteImage> getSpriteImages()
        Returns the list of SpriteImages that this Sprite has.

      • moveBy

        public void moveBy(int x,
          int y)
        Moves the sprite x pixels to the right and y pixels down.

      • advanceOneFrame

        public void advanceOneFrame()
        Shows the next image of this Sprite. Called automatically by the engine every frame.

      • placeAbove

        public void placeAbove(Sprite that,
              int d)
        Places this sprite d pixels above the given sprite. Affects the vertical axis only.

      • placeBelow

        public void placeBelow(Sprite that,
              int d)
        Places this sprite d pixels below the given sprite. Affects the vertical axis only.

      • placeLeftOf

        public void placeLeftOf(Sprite that,
               int d)
        Places this sprite d pixels to the left of the given sprite. Affects the horizontal axis only.

      • placeRightOf

        public void placeRightOf(Sprite that,
                int d)
        Places this sprite d pixels to the right of the given sprite. Affects the horizontal axis only.

      • isAbove

        public boolean isAbove(Sprite that)
        Tests if this sprite is above the given sprite. Does not check the horizontal axis.

      • isBelow

        public boolean isBelow(Sprite that)
        Tests if this sprite is below the given sprite. Does not check the horizontal axis.

      • isLeftTo

        public boolean isLeftTo(Sprite that)
        Tests if this sprite is to the left of the given sprite. Does not check the vertical axis.

      • isRightTo

        public boolean isRightTo(Sprite that)
        Tests if this sprite is to the right of the given sprite. Does not check the vertical axis.

      • has

        public boolean has(Sprite that)
        Tests if the given sprite is colliding with the current sprite.

      • update

        public void update()
        Is called by the engine every frame. Override to add functionality.
